body:
strange! indeed we had some funniness with 3.9, but tables is in the pip setup (https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/f75daf5464571f46285de0523517afb7e17025f7/setup.py#L18), so not sure why it broke/did not install (sorry!) we will see what we can do. 

for 3, I needed to upgrade my. cuDNN, `conda install -c conda-forge cudnn` then my GPU was happy with me again, hope thats the easy fix
also @backyardbiomech good catch on blog, it's updated, and for ease, I just pinned the 2.2rc3 in the file now *and dropped pytables, if you want to try this again! http:\\blog.deeplabcut.org

On my mac, tables installs with pip. 

I'll check on the windows computer again, but it just decided to force a windows update so now I'm left waiting (remotely) for it to (hopefully) restart.

The blog's version of `DEEPLABCUT.yaml` worked on windows, mostly. Windows pip does not like the single quotes in `'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.2rc3`. When running in pip, it produces a somewhat helpful error, but when using the `DEEPLABCUT.yaml` file, it produces a scary looking anaconda error that's not very helpful. Simply removing the single quotes from that line works.

issue.title: AttributeError: module 'tensorflow' has no attribute 'logging'

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.10.4

i followed the instruction on the How to Use Standard DeepLabCut page, but it gives me the following error after running
python -m deeplabcut

AttributeError: module 'tensorflow' has no attribute 'logging'
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84589354/125059077-cc5b9100-e05f-11eb-880b-fd73fe75eda8.png)

Any help is appreciated. Thanks!

**How to Reproduce the problem**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. open anaconda prompt
2. activate DEEPLABCUT
3.  enter code: python -m deeplabcut

issue.title: Update DEEPLABCUT.yaml

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Users appear to be grabbing `DEEPLABCUT.yaml` from the repo in order to install `2.2rc3`. Unfortunately, it installs 2.1.10.4, and gets tables from conda rather than pip. Therefore, the instructions elsewhere to install the newest versions of the code with this conda env file are inaccurate. 

To eliminate confusion, the repo version of `DEEPLABCUT.yaml` should be updated to the same as the version on the blog.

On windows 10, I have tried using the existing repo file to install 2.1.10.4, then running `pip install deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc3`. While it appears to install ok, I get a tables error (seen in #1368 and #1398 ). Uninstalling pytables with conda and reinstalling with pip works sometimes (#1368), but just now I tested it again and created a tensorflow error.

body: @jeylau seems quotes are required for ubuntu, not for windows - maybe we need a work around?
@backyardbiomech is you do this, can this install on windows? `  "deeplabcut[gui]" `

### on the anaconda command line in windows 10
`pip install "deeplabcut[gui]"`  installs 2.1.10.4
`pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]'`  installs 2.1.10.4
`pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.2rc3`  produces `ERROR: Invalid requirement: "'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.2rc3"`
`pip install "deeplabcut[gui]"==2.2rc3`  installs 2.2rc3
`pip install "deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc3"` installs 2.2rc3
`pip install 'deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc3'` produces `ERROR: Invalid requirement:...`

### in the DEEPLABCUT.yaml env file when creating a new env
`pip install "deeplabcut[gui]"==2.2rc3`  produces an error
`pip install "deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc3"`  installs 2.2rc3

`pip install "deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc3"` also works on my mac.

It looks like surround the full `package==version` in double quotes is the only universal instruction across my platforms and installation pathways.

issue.title: cannot label frames

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** OS: WIN10 DeepLabCut Version:2.2rc3 Anaconda env used:yes **Describe the problem** when trying to save labled frames. i get an error to do with panda tables A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Please place code inside this:
Code output

[Please copy/paste the full terminal output of the error here!!!] Traceback (most recent call last): File "H:\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\labeling_toolbox.py", line 938, in saveDataSet self.dataFrame.to_hdf( File "H:\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\generic.py", line 2700, in to_hdf pytables.to_hdf( File "H:\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\pandas\io\pytables.py", line 311, in to_hdf with HDFStore( File "H:\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\pandas\io\pytables.py", line 572, in __init__ tables = import_optional_dependency("tables") File "H:\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\pandas\compat\_optional.py", line 118, in import_optional_dependency raise ImportError(msg) from None ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'. Use pip or conda to install tables.

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to python -m deeplabcut 2. Click on 'label' 3. label a frames, save or quit 4. See error **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. **Additional context** had alot of trouble installing DLC. many depencencies where contradictory and had to manually install each one that was missing and then the next, and then the next. in ubuntu. could not install deeplabcut[gui], as tensorflow needs numpy 1.19, and deeplabcut needs numpy 1.17

issue.title: `ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'.  Use pip or conda to install tables.` No data found after labelling frames

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2rc3
Anaconda env used: yes

After labeling and saving the frames, I proceeded to create a training dataset. However, the output from the terminal says: No data was found! I proceeded to click the check labels, and a message popped up saying: this will now plot the labeled frames after you have finished labeling.  Checking the terminal again, it produced the following result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84589354/126888875-28fb2b23-4220-4736-819f-653451feeb85.png). I reloaded the video and relabeled the frames, making sure I saved every frame, yet the error occurred again. Any help would be appreciated. Thank you.

issue.title: `ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'. Use pip or conda to install tables.`

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [ ] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Labeling of videos results in error
"ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'. Use pip or conda to install tables."

I've used pip install and conda install to install tables. It's definitely installed. I've also followed suggestions mentioned in #587 but none of the solutions fixed the error. 
 

![Code error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88189871/127643198-55b55bb4-13ae-4824-9e14-68c7ea8ca9a2.png)


### Operating System

Windows 10
numpy 1.19.5
tables  3.6.1

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version 2.2rc3

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

GeForce GTX 1080   

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output

```shell
ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'. Use pip or conda to install tables.

(See screenshot above for Traceback)
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
